skill.name: installing-skill-tracker
skill.description:
Installs Claude Code hooks for automatic skill usage measurement.
Use when setting up skill tracking infrastructure in a new project.
NOT when hooks are already installed (run verify.py to check).
skill.summary:
Installs Claude Code hooks for automatic skill usage measurement.
Use when setting up skill tracking...
skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: This skill creates local tracking hooks that log skill usage to project-local JSONL files. All data stays within the project directory. No network access or credential handling detected.

low_findings.title: Filesystem writes to project directories
low_findings.description: The setup.py script writes shell scripts to .claude/hooks/ and creates .claude/activity-logs/ directory. This is necessary for the stated tracking functionality but writes executable scripts to the project.

low_findings.title: External command execution in verification
low_findings.description: verify.py uses subprocess via shutil.which() to check for jq installation. This is limited to existence checking and poses minimal risk.

content.value_statement: Measure how often skills are used and which ones succeed or fail. Install tracking hooks to collect usage data for analytics and optimization.
actual_capabilities: Install Claude Code hooks for tracking user prompts
Detect and log when skills are activated
Generate analytics reports on skill usage patterns
limitations: Requires jq command-line tool for JSON processing
Does not track skills outside the project directory
Cannot retroactively collect data before installation

use_cases.title: Track team skill adoption
use_cases.description: Monitor which skills your team uses most and identify opportunities for improvement.

use_cases.title: Measure skill effectiveness
use_cases.description: Collect usage data to understand if your skills are being used correctly and successfully.

use_cases.title: Optimize skill selection
use_cases.description: Identify underutilized skills and eliminate those that consistently fail.

prompt_templates.title: Basic installation
prompt_templates.scenario: Set up tracking in a new project
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the skill tracker hooks for this project by running the setup script.

prompt_templates.title: Verify installation
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify that the skill tracker is properly installed by running the verification script.

prompt_templates.title: Check logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the skill analyzer to show me the usage logs for the past sessions.

prompt_templates.title: Full setup flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up and verify the skill tracker installation, then show me the initial analytics report.

output_examples.input: Install the skill tracker hooks for this project
output: Setup complete. Run verify.py to confirm.

best_practices: Run verify.py immediately after setup to confirm installation succeeded
Check that jq is installed before running setup (required for JSON parsing)
Review analytics regularly to identify skills that need attention
anti_patterns: Running setup when hooks are already installed (causes duplicate entries)
Installing without checking that jq is available on the system
Expecting retroactive data from before the hooks were installed

faq.question: Does this work with Claude or Codex?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for Claude Code specifically.

faq.question: What data is collected?
faq.answer: Prompts, skill activations, and verification results are logged to local JSONL files in the project.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with external tools?
faq.answer: The analytics script runs locally. Export the JSONL files to process them elsewhere.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All data stays in your project directory. No data is sent anywhere.

faq.question: Why is verification failing?
faq.answer: Check that jq is installed, the hooks directory exists, and settings.json contains the hook configurations.

faq.question: How is this different from other tracking tools?
faq.answer: This skill tracks Claude Code skill usage specifically using native hook mechanisms.
